title: Air Fryer Red Lentil Koftas
description: Spiced red lentil patties with aromatic herbs and warming spices, air-fried until golden and crispy. These protein-rich koftas are perfect served with yoghurt sauce, fresh salad, and warm flatbreads for a satisfying pescatarian meal.

method.instruction: Cook red lentils in 400ml boiling water for 12-15 minutes until soft and most water is absorbed. Drain any excess water and allow to cool slightly.
Transfer cooled lentils to a large bowl and mash roughly with a fork or potato masher, leaving some texture.
Add chopped onion, garlic, fresh coriander, parsley, all the spices, flour, salt, and pepper to the mashed lentils. Mix thoroughly until well combined.
With damp hands, shape the mixture into 8 small oval patties (about 6cm long). If mixture is too wet, add a little more flour.
Preheat air fryer to 180°C for 3 minutes.
Brush koftas lightly with olive oil on both sides and arrange in a single layer in the air fryer basket, leaving space between each one.
Air fry at 180°C for 12-15 minutes, carefully flipping halfway through, until golden brown and crispy on the outside.
Serve immediately with yoghurt sauce, fresh salad, and warm flatbreads or pitta.

storage.notes: Store cooked koftas in an airtight container. Reheat in air fryer at 180°C for 5-6 minutes until heated through and crispy. Freeze uncooked shaped koftas on a tray, then transfer to freezer bags. Cook from frozen, adding 3-4 minutes to cooking time.

tips: Make sure lentils are well-drained and cooled before mixing to prevent the mixture being too wet
Keep hands damp when shaping to prevent sticking
Don't overcrowd the air fryer - cook in batches if needed for best crispiness
For extra flavour, add 1/2 tsp of garam masala or a pinch of cayenne pepper
These work brilliantly in wraps with salad and pickles for lunch
Double the batch and freeze extras for quick midweek meals
